Literature Review: The electrocatalytic conversion of carbon dioxide (CO2) to valuable chemicals and fuels is a crucial step towards achieving net-zero carbon emissions. In situ/operando characterization techniques have been employed to study the structure-activity relationship and reaction mechanism of heterogeneous CO2/CO reduction. These techniques provide valuable insights into the dynamic evolution of catalysts and reaction intermediates under reaction conditions. However, the current state of the art is still limited by several challenges, including the need for more sensitive and selective detection methods, as well as the development of more robust and scalable in situ/operando systems.
